\l [A grandfather is being questioned by the police and, as an aside, the storyteller notes that he had to wait for his grandfather to return:] ‘It was a long time.

\t annwa Carmelle iiinoyiiwa omyi ksisskstakiyi
\g DEM-PROX C. IC-see-TA-DIR-PROX DEM-OBV beaver-OBV
\l Carmelle saw that beaver (nearby).

\t kiamyi nitaitapokska’sihpinnaan
\g CONJ-DEM-OBV IMPF-toward-run.AI-1PL
\l [A young man is helping his grandfather with a task that the police later take notice of; he is confused about why they are doing what they are doing.] ‘And we ran towards (something).

\t kiamyi nitohtitinnohpi’yi nitinno’takohpi’yi
\g CONJ-DEM-OBV 1-means-LOC-down-fall.AI 1-down-in.circle-fall.AI
\l [A child wants to go sledding with her sisters but they won’t share their sleds. She finds a wash basin and gleefully slides down the snowy hill in the basin.] ‘And with it, I went down, spinning in circles.

\t kiamyi niisto nitsstonnatsotamsapwaasai’ni
\g CONJ-DEM-OBV 1-PRN 1-extremely-genuinely-?-cry.AI
\l [A child wants to accompany her grandparents to a ceremonial event, but they tell her she is too young and leave without her.] ‘I kept crying and crying after them.

\t siksinnakiwa omyi omyi maatwaanistsi’toyiiwa omiksi matapiiksi
\g police-PROX DEM-OBV DEM-OBV NEG-obey.TA-DIR-PROX DEM-PL person-PL
\l [At a Sundance ceremony, a police officer violated ceremonial protocol by crossing in front of some dancers, and later that day he fatalistically broke his leg. The moral of the story:] ‘The policeman didn’t listen to the people.

\t ha’yaa
\g scorn-oh.no
\l uh-oh!’ (in anticipation of a reprimand)

\t annohk
\g DEM-RESTR-INVIS
\l right now

\t annyiayi
\g DEM-INAN-VBZR
\l that’s enough

\t kiann
\g CONJ-DEM
\l that’s all’ (often used to conclude a story)

\t ha’annyiya
\g PART-DEM-INAN-MVNG
\l Really! All right!

\t saahkayi
\g PART-INVIS-VBZR
\l just kidding

\t kika
\g CONJ-OTH.TM
\l wait!

\t sanem heʔn nsedaʕanaʕat daʔ yaqayadipi
\g A1-give M-CLF:near pole CLF:VER POS1-brother-PAUC-COL
\l I give the pole to my brothers.

\t hadačalo yawoʔ
\g F-CLF:VER=DEM1:DIST.VIS-PL woman-PAUC
\l those women (standing)

\t diʔ naʔaik
\g CLF:HOR road-M
\l road

\t damʔe yilaʔa daʔ epaq
\g CLF:VER=DEM1:NEUT A3-find-OBJ.SG CLF:VER tree
\l She/He sees a tree.

\t seb̶idewʔo ñiʔ tamnaʕaki
\g A1-arrive-LOC:outward CLF:NO.EXT religion-place
\l I arrive at the church.

\t naaʔ yʔaiʔte
\g CLF:near.PL POS1-eyes
\l my eyes

\t qančʔe yilaeyʔalo saaʔ taʕañi kʼoqtel
\g then 3-see.ahead-PL CLF:far.PL rosy.billed.duck offspring-PL
\l He suddenly saw some rosy-billed ducklings.

\t hogaʔ emek
\g M-CLF:absent house
\l that (unknown) house

\t qačʔe qoilawlo hoʔn lʔaiʔte ekey qodʔoyalo soʔ lʔaiʔte
\g CONJ SBJ.INDF-A3-see-PL M-CLF:near POS3-eye.PL INTJ SBJ.INDF-A3-fear-PL CLF:far POS3-eye.PL
\l They saw the eyes (coming) and they got scared.

\t yilaʔa hasoʔ waʕatʔo
\g A3-find-OBJ.SG F-CLF:far wasp
\l They found a wasp (in the forest).

\t naʔ qadatʔelpi daʔ setake dʔoʕonaʕan načʔe wʔaeñe yilake naʔ laqata lawa
\g CLF:near POS1PL-mother-PL-COL SUB want-DES A3-weave-NPROG-CAUS then be.first-COMPL A3-look.for CLF:near carandillo POS3-leaf
\l When our mothers want to weave (make handicrafts), first they look for carandillo (trithrinax schizophylla) leaves.

\t wʔo soʔ nloʔ soʔ waʕayaqalʔačiyi qataʕa soʔ doqotoʔ
\g EXIST CLF:far POS.INDF-day CLF:far fox and CLF:far dove
\l There was a day the fox and dove met each other.

\t soʔ siyaʕadipi daʔ setake diyʔako
\g CLF:far person-PAUC-COL SUB want-DES A3-fish
\l When the people want to go to fish, …

\t daʔ niyʔakoʕok daʔ čʔe npiyaeyi daʔ diyʔako naʔ siyaʕadipi
\g SUB B3-fish-M SUB suddenly B3-gather-PL SUB A3-fish CLF:near person-PAUC-COL
\l When it is fishing (time), when the people spontaneously gather to go hunter-gather (in general, lit. ‘fish’), …

\t načʔe daʔ yilew naʔ owaqae , načʔe soʔ koñem yalik hanamʔe owaqae
\g then SUB A3-die CLF:near peccary then CLF:far skunk A3-eat F-CLF:near=DEM1:NEUT peccary
\l When the peccary dies, then the skunk eats this peccary.

\t yikʔataʕasomʔa gaʔ lačiyaʔge
\g A3-go-LOC:down-OBJ.SG CLF:absent stream
\l They (prepare to) go to a/some stream.

\t soʔ tʔaeʔ napam
\g CLF:far little armadillo
\l the distant little armadillo

\t awʔaʕanyi hoʔ naʔ yiče
\g A2-HIT-LOC:MIDDLE DEM1:PROX CLF:NEAR POS1-LEG
\l Hit here (on) my leg!

\t heʔn četa hogamʔe siyak qanačʔe qoyačanyi hoʔ hagaʔ alewanʔoʕona
\g M-CLF:near grease M-CLF:absent-DEM1:NEUT animal then SBJ.INDF-A3-put-NPROG-LOC DEM1:PROX F-CLF:absent vessel
\l Then the fat of whatever animal they put there in an (earthenware) vessel (alewanʔoʕona).

\t čʔe Øek hoʔ demačetapeget soʔnegaʕawa waqaʔw
\g soon A3-go DEM1:PROX A3-hear-PROG-VEN CLF:far=POS.INDF-friend-HUM bird.species
\l Then, he (Fox) went away there [indicating the place where Waqaw was; not necessarily far or close], he heard his friend Waqaw (bird species) coming.

\t qančʔe naeʔgaʔ awmen hoʔ ñegaʕawa
\g then INTG=CLF:absent A2-sell DEM1:PROX POS1-companion-HUM
\l So what will you sell now, my companion?

\t hayem kaʔ sepa čʔe algún documento daʔ daʔ Øeka soʔ saλanek
\g 1SG before seem.to.me then some document SUB SUB 3-go-LOC:specific CLF:far chief-AGENT
\l I believed that, that the chief came back with the document

\t daʔ qomiʔ yaloʕonalo
\g SUB 1PL 3-show-NPROG-PL
\l so that he could show us.

\t daʔ kaʔ epaʕa autorisaw hoʔ etat
\g SUB before it.seems authorised DEM1:PROX say-PROG
\l He was saying that he seems authorised for this.

\t hanamʔe owaqae
\g F-CLF:near=DEM1:NEUT peccary
\l this peccary

\t naqaega hogamaʕa piyʔoʕonaq
\g DEM2:RCG=CLF:absent M-CLF:absent=DEM1:NVIS shaman
\l (Death could result from the action of) some/any shaman.

\t yeči ki hora daʔ hodamaʕa yem
\g evident what hour SUB M-CLF:VER=DEM1:NVIS A3-end
\l (I don’t know) what time that (the story) ends…

\t ñimaʕa ñiʔ qansaλaʕanek
\g CLF:NO.EXT=DEM1:NVIS CLF:NO.EXT POS1PL-chief-M
\l that our chief’ (not present at the time of utterance)

\t ñiʔtʔaemʔe
\g CLF:NO.EXT=DIM=DEM1:NEUT
\l that little rounded/sitting one’ (I may be seeing it or not)

\t daʔtʔaečaʔa
\g CLF:VER=DIM=DEM1:DIST.VIS
\l that far little one’ (I see it)

\t ñiʔmʔe ñiʔ taʔe
\g CLF:NO.EXT=DEM1:NEUT CLF:NO.EXT little
\l that little rounded/sitting one’ (I may be seeing it or not)

\t yilaʔa dihoʔ siyaʕawa
\g A3-see CLF:HOR=DEM1:PROX person
\l She/He saw this person lying down/asleep/dead.’ (The person is visible now and close; but need not currently be horizontal/dead.)

\t yilaʔa dimʔe siyaʕawa
\g A3-see CLF:HOR=DEM1:NEUT person
\l She/He saw a/that person lying/sleeping/dead.’ (The person may or may not be in sight at the time of speaking.)

\t yilaʔa dičaʔa siyaʕawa
\g A3-see CLF:HOR=DEM1:DIST.VIS person
\l She/He saw that far-away lying-down/asleep/dead person.’ (The person is visible now and far away; pointing to the person.)

\t yilaʔa dimaʕa siyaʕawa
\g A3-see CLF:HOR=DEM1:NVIS person
\l She/He saw that person lying down/asleep/dead.’ (The person is not visible to the speaker.)

\t naʔčʔa
\g CLF:near=DEM1:DIST.VIS
\l far referent coming near

\t naʔčʔaget
\g CLF:near=DEM1:DIST.VIS-VEN
\l far referent coming near

\t soʔčaʔageʔ
\g CLF:far=DEM1:DIST.VIS-IT
\l far referent going away

\t dočaʔa
\g CLF:VER=DEM1:DIST.VIS
\l that upright far referent

\t ñačʔalo
\g CLF:NO.EXT=DEM1:DIST.VIS-PL
\l those sitting there

\t noʔhoʔ naʔ taʔe
\g CLF:near=DEM1:PROX CLF:near little
\l this little one’ (right here beside me and I see it)

\t naʔmʔe naʔ taʔe
\g CLF:near=DEM1:NEUT CLF:near little
\l this little one’ (the item may be present or not; the expression could refer to something I have been talking about)

\t naʔčaʔa naʔ taʔe
\g CLF:near=DEM1:DIST.VIS CLF:near little
\l (he’s) that little one’ (there, not moving)

\t *soʔtaʔehoʔ
\g CLF:far=DIM=DEM1:PROX\t soʔtaʔemʔe
\g CLF:far=DIM=DEM1:NEUT
\l that small visible/identifiable departing referent

\t soʔtaʔečaʔage
\g CLF:far=DIM=DEM1:DIST.VIS-IT
\l that small visible far-away departing referent

\t soʔtaʔemaʕa
\g CLF:far=DIM=DEM1:NVIS
\l that little (stationary) unseen referent’ (perhaps I know it)

\t gaʔtaʔehoʔ
\g CLF:absent=DIM=DEM1:PROX
\l this little one’ (referring to something/somebody under discussion that is far or I do not remember well)

\t gaʔtaʔemʔe
\g CLF:absent=DIM=DEM1:NEUT
\l that little one’ (not in view, never seen, or unknown, but I remember it)

\t Qaya gaʔmʔe
\g NEXIST.HUM CLF:absent=DEM1:NEUT
\l There is nobody.

\t soʔ yalek
\g CLF:far POS1-son
\l my son (distant/absent)

\t sohoʔ yalek
\g CLF:far=DEM1:PROX POS1-son
\l that my son (departing)

\t somʔe yalek
\g CLF:far=DEM1:NEUT POS1-son
\l that my son (distant/absent)

\t naqaesoʔ yalek
\g DEM2:RCG=CLF:far POS1-son
\l that (is) my son’ (understood to not be present)

\t sohoʔ
\g CLF:far=DEM1:PROX
\l there’ (Spanish allá) / ‘one (who is) departing

\t hanhoʔ mate
\g F-CLF:near-DEM1:PROX mate(drink)
\l This is a mate (container).

\t maλaʕa qaga hañohoʔ naʕa nañʔa dyohoʔ Campo
\g yet NEXIST F-CLF:NO.EXT=DEM1:PROX now B3-sit-OBJ.SG CLF:HOR=DEM1:PROX place.name
\l This [pointing to the place of the community] did not yet exist (which) is now (the spread-out community of) Estanislao del Campo.

\t henmʔe huw !
\g M-CLF:near=DEM1:NEUT wow
\l this (story), wow!’ (meaning ‘this story I am telling you’)

\t somʔe siyaʕadipi daʔmʔe qoilaʔa soʔ konʼayaʕapoλoʔ
\g CLF:far=DEM1:NEUT person-PAUC-COL CLF:VER=DEM1:NEUT SBJ.INDF-see-OBJ.SG CLF:far bee.hive
\l When the men find the bee hive,

\t načʼe wʼaeñe daʔmʔe
\g soon be.first-COMPL CLF:VER=DEM1:NEUT
\l they first do this:

\t qoyalon soʔ doleʔ
\g SBJ.INDF-A3-stir-NPROG CLF:far fire
\l they stir up the fire.

\t degesesow eso wayqalʼačiyi yači enaʕayeik
\g quickly CLF:far fox certain dusty-AUG
\l Quickly, it is clear/certain that the fox stirred up a lot of dust.

\t soʔ qololo daʔ Øwenot qanačʔe yitaʕa nenoʕosegem soʔ qololo lqaya
\g CLF:far toad SUB A3-jump then again B3-move-upward CLF:far toad POS3-sibling
\l But when the toad jumped, another toad appeared.

\t ta Øwenot ta nenoʕosegem soʔ qololo lqaya yedʔata
\g AGAIN A3-jump again B3-move-upward CLF:far toad POS3-sibling A3-arrive-OBJ.SG-other.side
\l He jumped again, and another toad (appeared until) it reached the finish.

\t qančʔe soʔtʔaemʔe qančʼe yeči , nselkapeget ñiʔčaʔaw ñiʔ nqomitaʕawa ñiʔ yači yiweʔen
\g then CLF:far=DIM=DEM1:NEUT then certain B3-see-PROG-VEN CLF:NO.EXT=DEM1:DIST.VIS=INTSF CLF:NO.EXT B3-compete-NMLZ-HUM CLF:NO.EXT certain A3-laugh
\l He (Fox) certainly keeps looking for that far-distant one (toad) coming towards him and so he (toad, referenced throughout by ñiʔ) certainly/evidently laughs at the competitor (Fox).

\t diʔmaʕa diʔae qadʔačaqaʔ lenaʕat Colonia Ensanchez Ønaʔage naʔ seʔw
\g CLF:HOR=DEM1:NVIS CLF:HOR-F POS1PL-community POS3-name Colonia Ensanchez A3-be-it CLF:near north
\l This our community, its name (is) Colonia Ensanchez, is towards the north.’ (Context: The speaker is in a workshop talking about his far-distant community, probably looking at a map.)

\t ñiʔmaʕa ñiʔ qansaλaʕanek lsek hañiʔ tamnaʕaki
\g CLF:NO.EXT=DEM1:NVIS CLF:NO.EXT POS1PL-chief-M POS3-neighbor F-CLF:NO.EXT religion-LOC
\l That (far away house) (that I’m talking about from memory) of our chief is between the church (and the school).

\t dyohoʔ pioq čeʔeda wetañʔa kaliʔo
\g CLF:HOR-DEM1:PROX dog be.first be-LOC:below-OBJ.SG long.ago
\l This dog (present, that I am signaling) has been (lying) here a long time.

\t soʔ laqaya setaeʔ napaʕagena daʔ paʕagentanaʕaik henhoʔ woʔe
\g CLF:far POS2-brother want B3-learn-OBJ.SG SUB teacher.M M-CLF:near=DEM1:PROX year
\l Your brother wants to study teaching (to be a teacher) this year.

\t daʔ setake aeye diʔmʔe qadanaʕanqaʔ qanačʼe oketʼage diʔ naʔaik Ølekaʔaege
\g SUB want-DES A3-go-in.line CLF:HOR=DEM1:NEUT POS1PL-plant-CAUS-LOC then A2-continue-IT CLF:HOR road-M 3A-be.big-forward
\l If you want to get to our vegetable garden, you have to continue along the wide path.

\t čaqaga daʔ gaʔmʔe qadenataʕak
\g what SUB CLF:absent=DEM1:NEUT POS1PL-think-NMLZ
\l What (is) our thought? (i.e. ‘What shall we do?)

\t naqaeñi hoʔ ñiʔ siyaʕawa
\g DEM2:RCG=CLF:NO.EXT DEM1:PROX CLF:NO.EXT person
\l Ah, that/this is the person!’ (I see him/her, sitting)

\t qataʕa daʔ anawaʔn naaʔ lʔawaʕako naqaenawa naaʔ nayapeegʔalo hen ñiyaqpi
\g and SUB B2-watch-PL-NPROG CLF:near.PL POS3-water.channel-PL DEM2:RCG=CLF:near-PL CLF:near.PL B3-leave-PROG-LOC:specific-PL M-CLF:near fish-COL
\l Also to watch the water channels, these are where from the fish emerge.

\t lʔeʔ naqañi yʔataʔnyi naqaenaʔ yadik
\g why DEM2:RCG=CLF:NO.EXT A3-move-LOC:middle DEM2:RCG=CLF:near POS1-path
\l Why does this one move (be) in this my path?

\t wʼaeñi qomi qoyapaʕageneke daʔ qoyeʔet naʔ čikena
\g be.first-COMPL 1PL SBJ.INDF-A3-teach-AGENT-PL SUB SBJ.INDF-A3-prepare CLF:near arrow
\l First they taught us to prepare the arrows

\t qataʕa naʔ Øwapiñʼalo qataʕa naʔ naeyapeegeʔa naʔ ñiyaqapi
\g and CLF:near 3-be.place-PL and CLF:near B3-go-IPFV-opposite-OBJ.SG CLF:near fish-COL
\l and (to know) the places and where the fish pass by.

\t qataʕa qomi qoyapaʕageneke daʔ qoyayen naʔ ñiyaq
\g and 1PL SBJ.INDF-A3-teach-AGENT-PL SUB SBJ.INDF-A3-throw-NPROG CLF:near fish
\l Also they taught us how to stab a fish

\t qataʕa daʔ anawaʔn naaʔ lʔawaʕako naqaenawa naaʔ nayapegelo heʔn ñiyaqapi
\g and SUB B2-watch-pl-nprog CLF:near.PL POS3-caudal DEM2:RCG=CLF:near-PL CLF:near.PL B3-go-PROG-opposite-PL M-CLF:near fish-COL
\l and how to watch the flow where the fish come out.

\t eta hoʔ daʔ lasook daʔ siyaʕawa
\g it.is.said DEM1:PROX CLF:VER custom CLF:VER person
\l This is the custom of the person.’ (present)

\t eta hoʔ soʔ lasook soʔ siyaʕadipi
\g it.is.said DEM1:PROX CLF:far custom CLF:far person-PAUC-COL
\l This was the custom (of) the people.

\t noyetak naʕa soʔhoʔ yalek nwoʕom daʔ lqowaʕa
\g B3-cry-PROG now CLF:far=DEM1:PROX POS1-son B3-feel CLF:VER POS3-hunger
\l My son here/now was crying because he felt hunger.

\t qomle saqtanaʕan soʔ qadetalpi
\g later A1-tell CLF:far our.grandparents
\l I’m going to tell you about our ancestors.

\t awawʔoe gaʔ adewo …
\g A2-make-PL CLF:absent POS2-clothes …
\l you have to make your costumes …

\t setaqatapege ñohoʔ siyaʕawa
\g A1-talk-PROG-IT CLF:NO.EXT=DEM1:PROX person
\l I am talking to a/this person (sitting next/close to me).

\t setaqatapege ñimʔe siyaʕawa
\g A1-talk-PROG-IT CLF:NO.EXT=DEM1:NEUT person
\l I am talking now to a/that person (who is sitting).’ /

\t setaqatapege ñičaʔa siyaʕawa
\g A1-talk-PROG-IT CLF:NO.EXT=DEM1:DIST.VIS person
\l I was talking to that person now sitting (far from me).’ (Since he/she is far away, it is impossible to be talking to him/her right now.)

\t eta hodamaʕa lasook
\g it.is.said M-CLF:VER=DEM1:NVIS custom
\l It is said that is how the custom must have been.’ /

\t eta hodamʔe lasook
\g it.is.said M-CLF:VER=DEM1:NEUT custom
\l It is said this is what the custom is (like).’ (speaker is certain)

\t soʔ koñem wʔo soʔ maečʔe lawanaʕanqaʔ daʔ nawan naʔ owaqae
\g CLF:FAR skunk exist CLF:far own POS3-trap-NMLZ:place SUB B3-trap-NPROG CLF:near peccary
\l The skunk had his own trapping place in order to trap the peccary.

\t wačʔe qodʔoya daʔ nemataeyi gamʔ noʕonek
\g because SBJ.INDF-A3-fear SUB B3-puncture-PL CLF:absent=DEM1:NEUT POS.INDF-fish
\l Because they feared that the fish would damage it.

\t yipitetpalo sawa lʔaiʔte soʔ doqotoʔ daʔ toʕomaqčiglo
\g A3-want-PROG-PL CLF:far-PL POS3-eyes CLF:far dove SUB be.red
\l He wanted dove eyes that were red.

\t adapenaʔ ltʔa diʔm adapenaʔ mʔe yiwa
\g POS2-grandfather POS3-father CLF:HOR=DEM1:NEUT POS2-grandfather DEM1:NEUT POS1-spouse
\l the father of your grandfather (deceased) that was (my) husband

\t naegaʔ waʔaege nqoʔ gaʔnadik mʔe yilotʔa gaʔJoel
\g where be-opposite when CLF:absent=road DEM1:NEUT A3-see-OBJ.SG CLF:absent=Joel
\l Where is the road that goes directly to (lit. sees) (the house of) Joel?

\t yilaʔage načʔe yiloʔtege mʔe tayʔa
\g A3-see-IT soon A3-see-opposite DEM1:NEUT A3-go-inside-OBJ.SG
\l He follows it (a bee, with his gaze) to see (the place) where it goes inside (of the honeycomb).

\t Jeden Morgen hat der Pfleger den Heimbewohner gekämmt .
\g every morning has the.NOM nurse the.ACC resident combed
\l Every morning, the (male) nurse combed the (male) resident.

\t Dabei hat er oft …
\g during.this.process has he.PERS often …
\l During this process, he often …

\t Dabei hat der oft …
\g during.this.process has he.DEM often …
\l During this process, he often …

\t Dabei hat dieser oft …
\g during.this.process has he.DEM often …
\l During this process, he often …

\t Im Hafen ist dem Segler der Urlauber aufgefallen .
\g at.the harbour is the.DAT sailor the.NOM tourist noticed
\l At the harbour, the (male) sailor noticed the (male) tourist.

\t Wenig später hat er/der/dieser dann …
\g shortly afterwards has he.PERS/he.DEM/he.DEM then …
\l Shortly afterwards, he then …

\t Den Direktor will der Schüler begrüßen .
\g the.ACC principle wants the.NOM student to.welcome
\l The student wants to welcome the director.

\t Er like gammel som hu dama og kunne ALDRI klart å være sammen med en så gammel mann .
\g am equally old like she woman.DEF and could never managed to be together with a such old man
\l I’m as old as that woman and could never have coped being together with a man that old.

\t Jeg beundrer henne , den flinkeste jenta i klassen .
\g I admire her.ACC the cleverest.DEF girl.DEF in class.DEF
\l I admire her, the cleverest girl in the class.

\t Jeg beundrer hun flinkeste jenta i klassen .
\g I admire she.NOM cleverest.DEF girl.DEF in class.DEF
\l I admire that cleverest girl in the class.

\t Hun dama hun blei jo helt nerd da .
\g she woman.DEF she became yes totally nerd then
\l But that woman became a total nerd, as you know.

\t Hun von der Lippe hun hadde lært seg skikkelig .
\g she von der Lippe she had taught herself really

\t mais une entière joye et parfaite liberté .
\g But INDEF entire glad and perfect freedom
\l You know that there is a God. He is the big boss. He knew how to create everything without others to help him. He gives food (potatoes, bread) to everybody. He is very skillful in making everything, there is nobody else like him. If he wants to make a house, he does not make it like people, for you have to go and look for an axe for the wood, then cut reeds, take ropes and creepers and thus make a dwelling. But God is very skillful, he says in his spirit: I want the world, he is ready to look at the world. He said in his spirit. I want people ready to look at people. In the end he sends bad people down into hell, to the fire with the Maboya (Island Carib God/Devil) and the other Indians who have not wanted to live like good Christians. But for a good Christian, he is so good to put him in his paradise where one finds complete happiness. No pain, no work and no serfdom or slavery, but full pleasure and perfect freedom.

\t jw rḏinj mw n jb ḥbsw n ḥjj nn wn jrnj r rmṯ
\g LOC give-ANT=1SG water to thirsty clothes to naked NEG EX\PTCP.M.SG do-ANT=1SG against people
\l I gave water to the thirsty one, clothes to the naked one, on no occasion did I act against people.’ (Stela Louvre C 196)

\t nn wn mwtk ḥr ḫst
\g NEG.EX EX\PTCP.M.SG die\NMLZ-2SG.M on desert
\l You shall not die in the desert.’ (Sinuhe B 197)

\t nn wn ḥḥjk r nḥḥ
\g NEG.EX EX\PTCP.M.SG seek\NMLZ-PASS-2SG.M for eternity
\l You shall not be sought in eternity.’ (Harpist song, Theban Tomb 50, Text J)

\t ḫr jnn mn bḥz jmi jnitw pḥtj ḥn pwt
\g PRT if NEG.EX calf let\IMP bring-PASS DEF-bed and DEF-coffin
\l If there is no calf, let the bed and the coffin be brought.’ (Ostracon Berlin 12630, verso 1)

\t mnnute nsantok Apollôn
\g NEG-god except-M.2SG Apollo
\l There is no god but you, Apollo.’ (Till, KHML II 33, 16-17)

\t ni wn stsn
\g NEG exist\PTCP.M.SG place=3PL

\t ni wnt wn sḫ st
\g NEG COMPL exist\PTCP.PRED.M.SG remember F.3SG
\l There was no one who would remember it.’ (Berlin 13272)

\t pḥwj wgjjtf pw nn jṯt jnt
\g end-DU ramus-M.3SG COP without fetch-INF bring-INF
\l It means that the ends of his ramus are without movement back and forth.’ (Papyrus Edwin Smith, plate 3, l. 17)

\t is bn wn mdik sšw qnw
\g INTER NEG exist\NMLZ PREP=2SG.M scribes many
\l Don’t you have many scribes at your disposal?’ (Papyrus Anastasi 5, 11, 4)

\t nn s n imjrprḥḏ bn wn  lacuna  imjr
\g NEG.EX son to director_of_the_treasury NEG exist\NMLZ [heir] director
\l There is no son for the director of the treasury, there exists [no heir] for the director.’ (Wisdom of Ani 20, 5–7, O. Gardiner 357)

\t jw S > jw wn S
\g LOC S > LOC exist\PTCP.PRED S
\l There is S.

\t ni S > ni wn S
\g NEG.EX S > NEG exist\PTCP.PRED S
\l There is no S.

\t nn S > nn wn S
\g NEG.EX S > NEG exist\PTCP.PRED S
\l There is no S.

\t ni jrit P
\g NEG do\NMLZ-COMPL P
\l There is no action of P’ > ‘P was not done.

\t ni wnt š
\g NEG exist\NMLZ-COMPL S
\l There is no completed existence of S’ > ‘there is no S.

\g Zheng people have sell Zheng to Qin
\l There are people in Zheng who betray the country for Qin.' (CN《史記·秦本紀》Shiji 109–91 BC)

\t you canjun jian shu bairi xing , yi shouban pi sha zhi
\g have officer see rat day walk with board hit kill PRO
\l There was an officer who saw a rat walking in daytime, so he hit and killed it with a board.' (CN《世說新語》A New Account of the Tales of the World AD 420–581)

\t  you yi ge shibing  kanjian yi zhi laoshu dabaitian zai jie shang paolaipaoqu

\g can walk water above not sink
\l [He] can walk on water and won't sink.' (CN《抱朴子》Baopuzi AD 300–343)

\t ri yue chu mo qi zhong
\g sun moon out sink PRO within
\l The sun and moon appear there.' (CN《藝文類聚》Yiwen Leiju AD 624)

\t fu zai , guan qi zhi; fu mo , guan qi xing
\g father live observe his will father die observe his conduct
\l While one's father lives, observe his aspiration; when one's father dies, observe his conduct.' (CN《論語》The Analects BC 480–350)

\t er qin ji mo , suo ju zhai qin
\g two parents already die PRO dwell alone sleep
\l With the death of the parents, [he] lived alone in [his] place (for mourning).' (CN《顏氏家訓》Yanshi Jiaxun AD 420–581)

\g that.ACC never see-PTCP.PST-1SG NEG.EX.COP

\t Men korganim yoq .
\g I see-PTCP.PST-1SG NEG.EX.COP
\l I didn’t see.

\t Men ešlämägänmen .
\g I work-NEG-PTCP.PST-1SG
\l I didn’t work.

\t Jašlǝk uŋgan tügel .
\g crop grow-PTCP.PST NEG.EX.COP
\l The crops haven’t grown.

\t eeǯǝ , bičä jumǝ ketn !
\g grandmmother NEG.IMP thing do-IMP.PL
\l Grandma, don’t do anything.

\t oda deerän en šin oborudovanigə esə avxla , xöönnj öŋgär iršgoʁinʲ medx kergtä
\g now while-POSS.REFL this new equipment-ACC NEG take-CVB.SUC after-POSS.3 for.free come-PTCP.FUT-NEG-ACC-P.3 know-PTCP.FUT must
\l While as of now [we] haven’t received this new equipment, it is important to know that later on it won’t come free of charge.

\t xörǝn tavǝn duunad komendantin selvǝg ugaʁar madǝndǝ jovdǝg alʲ uga bääsǝn bolǯana
\g 20-EXT five-EXT kilometer-DAT commander-GEN advise NEG.COP-INS 1PL-DAT go-PTCP.HAB where NEG.COP be-PTCP.PST become-PROG-PRS
\l Without the commander’s permission, we could not get out anywhere (more than) 25 kilometres.

\t madndə , unär temän uga , mörən , xön , bodmalə
\g 1.PL-DAT true-INS camel NEG.EX.COP horse-EXT sheep-EXT cattle
\l Honestly speaking, there are no camels (on our farms), (only) horses, sheep, cattle.

\t sän jumǝn uga
\g good thing-EXT NEG.EX.COP
\l There is nothing good.

\t donta biši
\g crazy NEG-Q
\l Isn’t she crazy?

\t oda cagtə uvəl uvel bišǝ
\g now time-DAT winter winter NEG
\l Nowadays the winter is not (a real) winter.

\t asxna hotə dolan časla bišǝ
\g evening-GEN meal seven hour-COM NEG
\l The dinner is not at 7 o’clock (it will be at 8 p.m.).

\t terǝ ʁancxǝn gergǝnj bišǝ alʲ ezǝvltǝ olǯǝ avčǝ
\g that single wife-POSS.3 NEG.PRS or property find-CVB.IPFV take-EVID
\l He has not only obtained his wife but also a kingdom.

\t širä doorǝ mečik bäänä
\g table under ball be-PRS
\l There is a / the ball under the table.’ / ‘The ball is under the table.

\t mečik širä doorǝ uga
\g ball table under NEG.EX.COP
\l There is no ball under the table.

\t mečik širä doorǝ bišǝ
\g ball table under NEG.PRS
\l The ball is not under the table.

\t bi čon bišəv
\g 1.SG.NOM wolf NEG-1SG
\l I’m not a wolf.

\t xojr kövün xojr küükǝn däkčǝ tednä ǯilin küüktǝ ugač
\g two boy-EXT two girl-EXT again 3PL-GEN year-GEN child-PL NEG.COP=EVID
\l There are 2 boys and 2 girls and it looks like there is no more children with that year (of birth).

\t däkčǝ zarʁdǝ odsǝn uga
\g again court-DAT go-PTCP.PST NEG.COP
\l He hasn’t gone to court again.

\t tednä tuskar martxmǝn bišǝ
\g 3PL.GEN about forget-PTCP.FUT-AFF NEG.PRS
\l One should not forget about them.

\t sään kövüd tiigdǝm bišǝ !
\g good boy-PL do.so-PTCP.HAB-AFF NEG.PRS
\l Good boys do not act like this!

\t nanta xamdan untčaxšǝ
\g 1.SG-ASSOC together sleep-PROG-PTCP.FUT-NEG
\l (She) is not (at this moment) sleeping together with me.

\t meklätä usar xotǝ keǯǝ bolšgo
\g frog-ASSOC water-INS food do-CVB.IPFV become-PTCP.FUT-NEG
\l (She/he) cannot cook with water containing frogs.

\t ene mör ber jobalangi maγad γarγan cidaqu mör busu bui
\g DEM.PROX path FOC suffering-ACC certain exit-CAUS-CVB can-NPST.PTCP path ASC.NEG COP-PRS
\l This path is not the path that can save from suffering.

\t ike sayin mörin bišai bilei
\g very good horse-GEN NEG.PRS be.PST
\l This is not [a sign] of a very good horse.

\t ünen xudaliyini lablaji medekü biši
\g true lie-POSS.3 specify-CVB.IPFV know-PTCP.FUT NEG.PRS
\l We do not know if it is true or false.

\t sedkilde:n sanaqudu maniyigi küün küči:r yabuulugsan biši
\g heart-DAT-P.REFL think-PTCP.FUT-DAT 3PL-ACC man by.force go-CAUS-PTCP.PST NEG
\l (Although I am suffering so much I always) remember in my heart that that it was not so that a person sent us by force.

\t beyeni cuγa:r šarrqu bolo:d odbai gebe čigi ükügsen ügei
\g body-POSS.3 all-INS wound become-CVB.ANT go-PST say-PST CONC die-PTCP.PST NEG.EX.COP
\l Although (our camels) went there becoming covered with wounds, they did not die.

\t Mereka tidak menolong kami .
\g 3PL NEG help 1PL.EXCL
\l They didn’t help us.

\t Saya tidak lapar .
\g 1SG NEG hungry
\l I am not hungry.

\t Dia bukan /*tidak guru .
\g 3SG NEG NEG teacher
\l She isn’t a teacher.

\t Dia bukan tidur tetapi berbaring sahaja .
\g 3SG NEG sleep but mid-lie.down only
\l He is not sleeping, but only lying down.

\t Ia’ ukay uma ku .
\g that NEG rice.field 1SG
\l That is not my rice field.

\t Ku ukay pulay . Baru’ ka’ angkat .
\g 1SG NEG go.home just FUT go
\l I am not going home; I am just about to leave.

\t Kada matagur , okon .ko’ tidi ku ika !
\g don’t scold NEG mother 1SG.GEN 2SG.NOM
\l Don’t scold me, you are not my mother!

\t Okon .ko’ bobogon dialo ilot tanak yo dat maanakaw , suuon nogi .
\g NEG beat.OV 3SG that child 3SG REL steal.hab order.OV PRT
\l He doesn’t beat that child of his who keeps on stealing, he actually orders / sends him (to steal)!

\t Sala’ka lalaing ku io .
\g NEG=PRT child 1SG.GEN 3SG.NOM
\l He is not my child.

\t Sala’ka aku mangansak ra kaluu’ .
\g NEG=PRT 1SG.NOM cook ACC rice
\l I didn’t cook rice.

\t Loin ko disio baloi dino .
\g NEG PRT his house that
\l That house is not his.

\t Loin ko idagang ku anak ku .
\g NEG PRT be.sold 1SG.GEN child 1SG.GEN
\l It’s not like I’m selling my child.’ (said during bride-price negotiations)

\t Siti apon mangan bakas .
\g Siti NEG eat wild.pig
\l Siti does not eat pork.

\t aku pǝngka pon atow muli , aku atow , …
\g 1SG NEG NEG know return 1SG know …
\l It is not the case that I do not know how to go home, I do know.' (lit. I do not not know (how) to go home, I do know)

\l «I have given to the pigs»? Formerly, every family had a pig, two, three, and everybody knew what it meant. Nowadays we probably might have to say: «I gave to eat to the pigs» or «I fed my pigs».' (Cavòrgja, f1)

\t «Gjòn , vul té bétga gidá mè da cargè quèla bùra ?» «Bèn bèn , scù ju pùs , vi ju schòn gidá .»
\g PN want.PRS.2SG 2SG NEG help.INF 1SG COMP carry.INF DEM.F.SG block yes yes as 1SG can.PRS.1SG want.PRS.1SG 1SG certainly help.INF
\l «Gion, don’t you want to help me charge this block?» «Yes, sure, I will certainly help [you] as well as I can.»' (Sadrún, )

\t … api vòu anflau in bi ljuc , api lu … lèv’ ju fá bògn lò …

\l […] and then I found a nice place, and then I wanted to take a bath there […].' (Sadrún, m8, sec:8.12)

\t Sas tgé quaj vut dí ?

\l Do you know what this means?' (Ruèras, f4, sec:8.16)

\t Ja da detg da mia sora tgi la vegna no .

\l I told my sister to come here.' (Surmiran, Marmorera, 519)

\t Ja do(u)m in mail da chel umfant .

\t … al bùrdi stèva ò ualti gljunsch , quaj balantschava in téc .

\t A quèla tauna vò vidajn – quaj tgu sùn stauṣ ajn – vò lò vidajn circa véntgatschún mè̱tars , san_ ins í vidajn da quèla , api sasparti , vòi ajn duas .

\t A la sèra par tga briṣchi bétg … vagnéva quaj , quaj mava `l ajnagjù cul maun èra sènza …  vòns  a trèva vidò̱ còtgla giù sé sél plantschju .
\g and DEF.F.SG evening for SUBORD burn.PRS.SBJV.3SG NEG _ PASS.AUX.IMPF.3SG DEM.UNM DEM.UNM go.IMPF.3SG 3SG.M in_down with.DEF.M.SG hand also without _ [glove.M.PL] and pull.IMPF.3SG out charcoal.COLL down up on.DEF.M.SG floor

\t Qu' è lu ju tschèlui̱sa tga ca nuṣ èssan vagí vidòra , turnaj ò da Pardatsch , tg' èssan nus staj ajn lò fòrsa … quátar tschun jamnas .

\t A lu èra PN ah atgnamajn mju … schèf , api lura va ju in’ jèda talafònau dad èl pr̩quaj tg' èl vèva tr̩mèz in’ anunzja da mòrt , álṣò ina carta par , ah , quèls sòn è schòn quaj , ùsa mataj tgé … ùsa sa ju amblidá quèla , quèla lavur tgu fagèva bugèn cun mi' ùm , api lu va ju … tlafònau dad èl a détg , èba , mi' ùm ségi èba mòrts scù i sápian , ábar … ju fagèssi ugèn vinavaun quèla lavur , api ò `l détg:
\g and then COP.IMPF.3SG PN eh actually POSS.1SG.M.SG _ boss and then have.1SG 1SG one.F.SG time call.PTCP.UNM DAT 3SG.M because SUBORD 3SG.M have.IMPF.3SG send.PTCP.UNM INDEF.F.SG announcement of death.F.SG this_is_to_say INDEF.F.SG card SUBORD eh DEM.M.PL know.PRS.3PL also already DEM.UNM now probably COMP _ now can.PRS.1SG 1SG forget.INF DEM.F.SG DEM.F.SG job REL.1SG do.IMPF.1SG gladly with POSS.1SG.M.SG man and then have.PRS.1SG 1SG _ call.PTCP.UNM DAT 3SG.M and say.PTCP.UNM exactly POSS.1SG.M.SG man be.PRS.SBJV.3SG precisely die.PTCP.M.SG as 3PL know.PRS.SBJV.3PL but 1SG _ do.COND.INDIR.1SG with_pleasure still DEM.F.SG job and have.PRS.3SG 3SG.M say.PTCP.UNM
\l And then P.N. was actually my … boss, and then I phoned him once, because he had sent a death notice, that is to say a card for, ah, they already knew that, now probably that … now I can forget about this, this job I loved to do with my husband, and then I … phoned him and said that my husband had died as they knew, but … that I would like to keep doing this job, and then he said:

\t «Mir sind nid so frauäfintlich .»
\g we are not so misogynistic
\l We are not really misogynistic.

\l And then I said: «Oh, great!»

\t A sjantar òi gju nùm … i sé̱gia , i mídian ò tùt als muossavías .

\g and now have.PRS.3PL.3PL divide.PTCP.UNM in DEM.UNM DEF.M.SG canton have.PRS.3SG about thirty of DEM.M.PL head_of_district.PL DEM.M.PL PASS.AUX.PRS.3PL divide.PTCP.M.PL in in region.F.PL and 1SG have.PRS.1SG DEF.F.SG valley PN and PN

\t A quèla tauna vò vidajn – quaj tgu sùn stauṣ ajn – vò lò vidajn circa véntgatschún mè̱tars , san inṣ_ í vidajn da quèla , api sasparti , vòi ajn duas .
\g and DEM.F.SG cave go.PRS.3SG into _ DEM.UNM REL.1SG be.PRS.1SG COP.PTCP.M.SG in _ go.PRS.3SG there into about twenty-five metre.M.PL can.PRS.3SG GNR go.INF into of DEM.F.SG and REFL.divide.PRS.3SG.EXPL go.PRS.3SG.EXPL in two.F
\l And this cave – [judging from] where I have been into it – one can go into it about 25 metres, and then it splits into two.

\t Ah , tgé … prandèvan pròpi òra sa ins bégj' éxáct , dí dian ins matalṣ , ábar ò vèza quaj insùma bégj in grép da matal .
\g eh what _ take.IMPF.3PL exactly out know.PRS.3SG GNR NEG exact.ADJ.UNM say.INF say.PRS.3SG GNR metal.M.PL but out look.PRS.3SG DEM.UNM at_all NEG INDEF.M.SG rock.M.SG of metal.M.SG
\l Ah, what … they really mined one does not know exactly, people say that it is metals, but this rock doesn't look like it contained metals at all.

\t Préndar ajn , pù schòn èssar tga samidav’ al grép , tga … a dí di la … la détga di tg’ è̱rian schindanajn tg' i udé̱vian c’ i tucavi da mjadṣdé ajnt Ruèras .

\l As for mining, it could well be that the rock changed, that …, the legend says that they were so deep in the cave that they heard the clock strike noon in Rueras.

\g and then have.IMPF.3SG DEM.F.SG simply also DEM.F.SG speak.IMPF.3SG then instead_of German.M.SG Italian.M.SG and then have.IMPF.1PL 1SG here really INDEF.M.SG corner REL PASS.AUX.IMPF.3SG only speak.PTCP.UNM Romansh.M.SG
\l And then that one also had, instead of speaking German she spoke Italian, and then we had here a real Romansh corner where only Romansh was spoken.

\g and one.F.SG time be.PRS.1PL 1PL go.PTCP.M.PL from of _ DEF.M.SG PN _ until to _ PN _ in.DEF.M.SG canton PN
\l And once we went from … the Alpsu to … Guttannen … in the canton of Bern.

\l And then we went to … the first … night we slept in Realp, the second night we slept in Tiefenbach.

\t Avaun , navèn da Realp essan nuṣ i dad ina … dad in … trùtg sédòra tòcan séssúr las lavinèras , a … sésúr las lavinèraṣ ah èssan nus lu i , quaj vò sé ancù̱ntar l’ AlbertHeimHütte … èssan nus , quaj èssan nuṣ i sé pr̩ … pr̩ bitga stuaj ira sé la … sé la via dad autòs , sé la via dal pas .
\g before away from PN be.PRS.1PL 1PL go.PTCP.M.PL from INDEF.F.SG _ from INDEF.M.SG _ footpath up until up_over DEF.F.PL avalanche_barrier.PL and _ up_over DEF.F.PL avalanche_barrier.PL ah be.PRS.1PL 1PL then go.PTCP.M.PL DEM.UNM go.PRS.3SG up towards DEF.F.SG PN-PN-hut _ be.PRS.1PL 1PL DEM.UNM be.PRS.1PL 1PL go.PTCP.M.PL up SUBORD _ SUBORD NEG must.INF go.INF up DEF.F.SG _ up DEF.F.SG way of car.M.PL up DEF.F.SG way of.DEF.M.SG pass
\l Before, from Realp we went on a footpath [which lead us] above the avalanche barriers and above the avalanche barriers we went then, this goes up towards the Albert-Heim-hut … we … there we went up in order to avoid the car road, the road of the pass.

\t Avaun òns fagèvan transpòrts da da caṣchial tégn ju , a … a raquèntani aun òz .
\g before year.M.PL make.IMPF.3PL transport.M.PL of of cheese.M.SG hold.PRS.1SG 1SG and _ and tell.PRS.3PL.3PL still today
\l Years ago they used to organise transports of of cheese, I think, and … and they still talk about [these things] today.

\t Què è btg ina lada sènda , quèl’ èra fòrsa … ah in mè̱tar a miaz , struṣch duṣ , a lu èssan nuṣ , gè in mè̱tar a miaz plétò̱st a mintgataun èri aun grépa tga stèv’ ò in téc … .
\g DEM.UNM COP.PRS.3SG NEG INDEF.F.SG broad path DEM.F.SG COP.IMPF.3SG maybe … _ eh one.M.SG metre and half almost two and then be.PRS.1PL 1PL yes one.M.SG metre and half rather and sometimes EXIST.IMPF.3SG.EXPL moreover rock.COLL REL stand.IMPF.3SG out INDEF.M.SG bit
\l This is not a broad path, it was maybe … eh one metre, almost two, and then we, yes rather one and a half metre and from time to time there were rocks protruding a bit … .

\t Quaj èra atgnamajn la fòntauna la plé impurtònta da hanlètg , quèla fiara da Ligjaun .
\g DEM.UNM COP.IMPF.3SG actually DEF.F.SG source DEF.F.SG most important of business.M.SG DEM.F.SG market of PN
\l This was actually the most important source of business, that market in Lugano.

\t Álṣò quaj , quaj èra lura , ajn Tujétsch èri usché da quèls mulissiars , álṣò quèls «Unterhändler» , né , né quèls mulissiars , quèls ah fagèvan lu quasi las préfatschè̱ntas , né , né tg’ èran … cumissunaj da quèls ah martgadònts grònṣ da la bassa , né .
\g well DEM.UNM DEM.UNM COP.IMPF.3SG then in PN EXIST.IMPF.3SG.EXPL so of DEM.M.PL negotiator.PL well DEM.M.PL negotiators right or DEM.M.PL negotiator.PL DEM.M.PL eh do.IMPF.3PL then so_to_speak DEF.F.PL intermediate_trade.PL right or REL PASS.AUX.IMPF.3PL _ commission.PTCP.M.PL by DEM.M.PL eh businessman.PL big.PL of DEF.F.SG «lowlands» right
\l Well, this, this is then, in the Tujetsch Valley there were some negotiators, well these «Unterhändler», right? These negotiators, they would so to speak do the intermediate trade, or they were … commissioned by the big businessmen from outside the Grisons, right?

\t Quèls vèvan quasi in téc maun líbar , né , da fá las cùmpras , né , a lu mavi quasi ṣur quèlṣ íntèrns òra , né , a da quèls martgadònts ah tuatschíns òi adina dau , quèls tg’ òn ugagjau a rascau quaj .
\g DEM.M.PL have.IMPF.3PL so_to_speak a bit hand.M.SG free.M.SG right SUBORD do.INF DEF.F.PL shopping.PL right and then go.IMPF.3SG.EXPL so_to_say over DEM.M.PL domestic.PL out right and of DEM.M.PL negotiator.PL eh from_Tujetsch.M.PL have.PRS.3SG.EXPL always EXIST.PTCP.UNM DEM.M.PL REL have.PRS.3PL dare.PTCP.UNM and risk.PTCP.UNM DEM.UNM
\l These had so to speak a bit of a free hand, right, to do the shopping, right, and then business was in the hands of the domestic merchants, right, and there were always some of these negotiators from the Tujetsch valley, right, those who dared and risked [to do] this.

\t Álṣò … la résca èra atgnamajn fétg grònda , parquaj tga … èls cumpravan gè … la pr̩mavèra , a lura savèvani bégja cù ṣè `l préci , cù ṣè la féjra insùma , ṣai atractif , ṣè la tschèrca cò , né .
\g well _ DEF.F.SG risk COP.IMPF.3SG in_fact very big.F.SG because SUBORD _ 3PL.M buy.IMPF.3PL in_fact _ DEF.F.SG spring and then know.IMPF.3PL.3PL NEG how COP.PRS.3SG DEF.M.SG price how COP.PRS.3SG DEF.F.SG market at_all COP.PRS.3SG.EXPL attractive.ADJ.UNM COP.PRS.3SG DEF.F.SG demand here right
\l Well, the risk was in fact very big, because … in fact they used to buy … during spring, and then they wouldn’t know how the price would be, what the market was supposed to be, whether it would be attractive at all, would there be some demand, right?

\t Quaj scriva Gadola , scriv’ è quaj zanú , quèla è zatgéj ina , ina lavur , «La fiera da Ligjaun» , a lu dascriva la òrd vésta dal Tujétsch scù quaj funcsanava , cù i mavan , a lu èri è quèls prígals tga dèva sén ah , ah , sén ira , naturálmajn cu i vagnévan anavù̱s scha savèvan als cugljúns , né , la nara , né , savèvan è quèls òn … bùrsas plajnas , né , a vagnévan lura pr̩ part atacaj ad angulaj .
\g DEM.UNM write.PRS.3SG PN write.PRS.3SG also DEM.UNM somewhere DEM.F.SG COP.PRS.3SG something DEF.F.SG INDEF.F.SG work DEF.F.SG market of PN and then describe.PRS.3SG 3SG.F out_of sight of.DEF.M.SG PN how DEM.UNM function.IMPF.3SG how 3PL go.IMPF.3PL and then EXIST.IMPF.3SG.EXPL also DEM.M.PL danger REL EXIST.IMPF.3SG on eh eh on go.INF natural.M.SG.ADV when 3PL come.IMPF.3PL back CORR know.IMPF.3PL DEF.M.PL scoundrel.PL right DEF.F.SG mad_people.COLL right know.IMPF.3PL also DEM.M.PL have.PRS.3PL _ wallet.F.PL full.PL right and PASS.AUX.IMPF.3PL then for part.F.SG attack.PTCP.M.PL and steal.PTCP.M.PL
\l This Gadola writes, writes also this somewhere this, the, this is a, a work with the title «La fiera da Ligjaun», and this work describes from the point of view of the Tujetsch valley how this used to function, how they used to go, and then there were these dangers which [one encountered] when travelling, of course when they would come back, the scoundrels, the madmen, right, they also knew that those had full wallets, right, and they were sometimes attacked and got robbed.

\t Quaj òi dau savèns , gè .
\g DEM.UNM have.PRS.3SG.EXPL EXIST.PTCP.UNM often yes
\l This happened often, yes.

\t Má tga quèls scapava tgi drètg a saniastar , a lu , ad al problèm gròn èra cu nus mavan ajnasé séssum la pastira da Sadrún stuèvan nuṣ í gjù tral Drun , quèl , al dargún tga végn gjùadòra cò , a tral Drun , a qu’ èra lu mù in pin trùtg , a suèntar vi dad ina … gjassa sédòra tòcan sé Valtgèva .
\g since SUBORD DEM.M.PL run_away.IMPF.3SG who right and left and then and DEF.M.SG problem big COP.IMPF.3SG when 1PL go.IMPF.1PL in_and_up on_top DEF.F.SG pasture of PN must.IMPF.1PL 1PL go.INF down through.DEF.M.PL PN DEM.M.SG DEF.M.SG torrent REL come.PRS.3SG down_and_out here and through.DEF.M.SG PN and DEM.UNM EXIST.IMPF.3SG then only INDEF.M.SG small path and after over of INDEF.F.SG _ narrow_path up_and_out until up PN
\l Since they would run away to the right or to the left, and then, the biggest problem was when we would go up to the top of the pasture of Sedrun, we had to go down through the river Drun, this, the torrent that comes down here, and through the Drun, there was only a small path, and after this via a small path for the cattle up to Valtgeva.

\t A dumagnè als amprèmṣ dis quèls pòrs gjù da da quaj trùtg ajnagjù a sjantar atrás l’ aua dal Drun tga vagnéva mù pauc vi da tschèla vart , qu’ è stau álṣò in martéri , a nuṣ vajn gju da samudargè , ju sa , mia mùma è saglida sjantar in piartg tg’ èra scapaus , ad ju sa aun bégn tg’ èl’ èra vagnida tùt còtschna , ad èla vèva gju da fá cul cùr , èla vèva magari in téc pròblè̱ms cul cùr , a qu’ èra stau par èla mèmja hèfti .
\g and cope.INF DEF.M.SG first.PL day.PL DEM.M.PL pig.PL down from from DEM.M.SG path into_and_down and after through DEF.F.SG water of.DEF.M.SG PN REL come.IMPF.3SG only little over of DEM.F.SG side DEM.UNM. be.PRS.3SG COP.PTCP.UNM well INDEF.M.SG ordeal and 1PL have.PRS.1PL have.PTCP.UNM to REFL.struggle.INF 1SG know.PRS.1SG POSS.1SG.F.SG mother be.PRS.3SG run.PTCP.F.SG after INDEF.M.SG pig REL be.IMPF.3SG run_away.PTCP.M.SG and 1SG know.PRS.1SG still well REL 3SG.F be.IMPF.3SG become.PTCP.F.SG completely red.F.SG and 3SG.F have.IMPF.3SG have.PTCP.UNM to do.INF with.DEF.M.SG heart 3SG.F have.IMPF.3SG sometimes INDEF.M.SG bit problem.M.PL with.DEF.M.SG heart and DEM.UNM be.IMPF.3SG COP.PTCP.UNM for 3SG.F too violent.ADJ.UNM
\l And the first days, to cope with these pigs [going] down this path and then through the water of the Drun, of which only few would go over to the other side, well, this was an ordeal, and we had to struggle, I know, my mother ran after a pig that had run away, and I still remember very well that she had turned completely red, and she had had heart problems, she sometimes had some problems with her heart, and this had been too violent for her.

\t Ábar èla èra lu tutina aun vagnida … pulit véglja . Parví da quaj , ábar èla vèva gju lò ina , in hèfti ad …
\g but 3SG.F have.IMPF.3SG then nevertheless still become.PTCP.F.SG … _ quite old.F.SG because of DEM.UNM but 3SG.F have.IMPF.3SG have.PTCP.UNM there INDEF.F.SG INDEF.M.SG violent and
\l But she nevertheless got … quite old. Because of that, but she then had had there a, a, violent, and … .

\t A quaj è rastau da mé , a lu … sjantar in pèr dis … vajn nus savju dumigná quèls pòrs … tga mavan pulit , a lu mava … in òrdavaun a lu mavan quèls pòrs tùt ajn còrda … da quaj trutg ajnagjù vi tra l' aua a sé tòcan sé Valtgèva .
\g and DEM.UNM be.PRS.3SG remain.PTCP.UNM DAT 1SG and then _ after INDEF.M.SG couple day.M.PL _ have.PRS.1PL 1PL can.PTCP.UNM cope.INF DEM.M.PL pig.PL _ REL go.IMPF.3PL proper.ADJ.UNM and then go.IMPF.3SG _ one.M in_front and then go.IMPF.3PL DEM.M.PL pig.PL all in single_file.F.SG _ from DEM.M.SG path in_and_down over through DEF.F.SG water and up until up PN
\l And I still remember this, and then … after a couple of days … we were able to cope with these pigs … which would move properly, and then … one would move in front and then the other pigs would follow in single file … down this path and through the water up to Valtgeva.

\t A nuṣ duṣ èra cun la tgapjala cun sé ina bjala flur , a da scargjá `ls pòrs usché , qu’ è stau pr̩ nus in aparti avanimajn .
\g and 1PL two.M also with DEF.F.SG hat with on INDEF.F.SG beautiful flower and COMP drove_down.INF DEF.M.PL pig.PL so DEM.UNM be.PRS.3SG COP.PTCP.UNM for 1PL INDEF.M.SG special event
\l And also the two of us with the hats with a beautiful flower on them, and to drove down the pigs in such a way, that was a special event for us.

\t Ad ad in piartg … ah … vèva pudju scapá sé Valtgèva tras la sajf , qu’ er’ ina , la sajv èr' ina , la sajv vèva rùt in palé , quaj vèva pudju atrás , a quaj … vèz' ju aun òz , quaj piartg èra juṣ atráṣ a vèva rùt gjù al matg tga vèva mù la còrda plé antù̱rn .
\g and and INDEF.M.SG pig _ eh _ have.IMPF.3SG can.PTCP.UNM escape.INF up PN through DEF.F.SG fence DEM.UNM COP.IMPF.3SG INDEF.F.SG DEF.F.SG fence COP.IMPF.3SG INDEF.F.SG DEF.F.SG fence have.IMPF.3SG break.PTCP.UNM INDEF.M.SG post DEM.UNM have.IMPF.3SG can.PTCP.UNM through and DEM.UNM _ see.PRS.1SG 1SG still today DEM.M.SG pig be.IMPF.3SG go.PTCP.M.SG through and have.IMPF.3SG break.PTCP.UNM down DEF.M.SG bunch SUBORD have.IMPF.3SG only DEF.F.SG rope more around
\l And and a pig … eh … had been able to escape in Valtgeva through the fence, that was a, the fence was, had a broken post, so it had been able to go through, and this … I still see it today, this pig had gone through and had broken the bunch of flowers so that he only had the rope around [his belly].

\t A , a lu vajn nus dascargjau cun gròn plaṣchaj , quaj è naturálmajn ina ònur , dascargjau als pòrs .
\g and and then have.PRS.1PL 1PL drove_down.PTCP.UNM with big.M.SG pleasure DEM.UNM COP.PRS.3SG natural.M.SG.ADV INDEF.F.SG honour drove_down.PTCP.UNM DEF.M.PL pig.PL
\l And, and then we drove down [the pigs] with great pleasure, this is naturally an honour, drove down the pigs.

\t A lu , parví da la piaglja , nuṣ vèvan lu dad í ad incassá .
\g and then because of DEF.F.SG wage 1PL have.IMPF.1PL then to go.INF SUBORD collect.INF
\l And then, because of the wage, we had to go and collect [the money].

\t Api sjantar sùnd ju saṣjuṣ gjù , api vau tartgau gè ábar ah , api sau bigj’ ajfach í ál’ aua .
\g and after be.PRS.1SG 1SG sit.PTCP.M.SG down and have.PRS.1SG.1SG think.PTCP.UNM yes but eh and can.PRS.1SG.1SG NEG simply go.INF into.DEF.F.SG water
\l And then I sat down and thought yes, but, eh, after all I should, I cannot simply jump into the water.

\t Api vau tartgau gè OK , lu stajn nus hald in téc cò .
\g and have.PRS.1SG.1SG think.PTCP.UNM yes OK then remain.PRS.1PL 1PL just INDEF.M.SG bit here
\l And then I thought yes, OK, in this case we’ll just stay here for a while.

\t Pi ṣè’ l vajramájn staus lò .
\g then be.PRS.3SG 3SG.M true.F.SG.ADV remain.PTCP.M.SG there
\l And the swan really stayed there.

\t Api vònzaj vau tartgau , ah ju a in’ idéa , ju vèva grat cumprau , ju vèva grat cumprau … quèla … suna da bùca .
\g and later have.PRS.1SG.1SG think.PTCP.UNM eh 1SG have.PRS.1SG INDEF.F.SG idea 1SG have.IMPF.1SG just buy.PTCP.UNM 1SG have.IMPF.1SG just buy.PTCP.UNM _ DEM.F.SG _ organ of mouth.F.SG
\l And after a while I thought, eh, I have an idea, I had just bought, I had just bought … that … harmonica.

\t A sia … sia dùna vèva nùm Marjuschla , a quèla tgèsa c’ inṣ vò cò da quòra vèva quèl … «il Segner ei» … mù spétga …  f4  «En tutta malura il Segner ei sisura .» …  m3  «En tutta malura il Segner ei sisura .» …  f4  Quaj cu té vaṣ anòra drètg .  m3  A cu nus mavan vidòra , ṣchèvan nus … i ṣchèvan … Marjuschla vèva quèla nùm … nuṣ ṣchèvan la Barjùtla … cu nus mavan spèrasò: «En tutta malura la Barjutla ei sis ura » .
\g and POSS.3SG.F.SG _ POSS.3SG.F.SG wife have.IMPF.3SG name.M.SG PN and DEM.F.SG house when GNR go.PRS.3SG here from here_out have.IMPF.3SG DEM.M.SG _ DEF.M.SG Lord COP.PRS.3SG _ only wait.IMP.2SG _ _ in all.F.SG disaster DEF.M.SG Lord COP.PRS.3SG above _ _ in all.F.SG disaster DEF.M.SG Lord COP.PRS.3SG above _ _ DEM.UNM when 2SG go.PRS.2SG out straight_ahead _ and when 1PL go.IMPF.1PL out say.IMPF.1PL 1PL _ 3PL say.IMPF.3PL _ PN have.IMPF.3SG DEM.F.SG name.M.SG _ 1PL say.IMPF.1PL DEF.F.SG PN _ when 1PL go.IMPF.1PL next_to_out in all.F.SG disaster DEF.F.SG PN COP.PRS.3SG above
\l And his … his wife was called Marjuschla, and that house, when you go from here in direction out of the valley, had … «the Lord is» just wait [f4] «In every disaster the Lord is above.» [m3] «In every disaster the Lord is above.» [f4] This if you go straight ahead in direction down the valley. [m4] And when we would go down the valley, we would say … they would say … she was called Marjuschla … we used to call her Barjùtla … when we would pass by: «In every disaster Bajùtla is above.»

\t Quaj pur vèva quèla vaca . Quaj èr’ ina vaca , ina mujèra scù inṣ di , quèla vèva bégja fatg vadí plé … lu quèlas vagnévan angarschèdas api … .
\g DEM.M.SG farmer have.IMPF.3SG DEM.F.SG cow DEM.UNM COP.IMPF.3SG INDEF.F.SG cow INDEF.F.SG cow_without_calves as GNR say.PRS.3SG DEM.F.SG have.IMPF.3SG NEG do.PTCP.UNM calf.M.SG more … _ then DEM.F.PL PASS.AUX.IMPF.3SG fatten.PTCP.F.PL and
\l This farmer had a particular cow. It was a «mujèra» as one says, this cow didn't have calves any more … so these were fattened and … .

\t Quèla vèva còrna usché davùsòra , pasanca tiar , a vèva sé in plèc a quèla mava mintg’ jè … tac , tac , tac , vònzaj èra la végn , trènta mèters ò dal múval api mavan tschèlas halt sjantar .
\g DEM.F.SG have.IMPF.3SG horn.COLL so back_out heavy.ELAT animal.M.SG and have.IMPF.3SG up INDEF.M.SG flat_bell and DEM.F.SG go.IMPF.3SG every time.F.SG _ ONOM ONOM ONOM later COP.IMPF.3SG 3SG.F twenty thirty metre.M.SG out of.DEF.M.SG cattle and go.IMPF.3PL dem.F.PL simply after
\l This one had horns that had grown backwards, a very heavy animal, and it had a flat bell, and it would always walk … tac, tac, tac, and a bit later it would be twenty, thiry metres away from the herd and the other cows would follow it.

\t  f4  Gè , gè , i è nuéta schi . Na , na , nuṣ vajn gju strèntg scù ufauns .
\g _ yes yes EXPL COP.PRS.3SG NEG so no no 1PL have.PRS.1PL have.PTCP.UNM hard.ADJ.UNM as child.M.PL
\l [f4] `Oh yes, it was not so (…). No no, we had a hard time as children.

\t  m3  Quaj èra da lavá … las quátar . Agl aut da la stat … èra quaj da lavá las quátar .
\g _ DEM.UNM be.IMPF.3SG to get_up.INF _ DEF.F.PL four DEF.M.SG high of DEF.F.SG summer _ be.IMPF.3SG DEM.UNM to get_up.INF DEF.F.PL four
\l [m3] `Then one had to get up … at four o'clock. When summer was at its highest point one had to get up at four o'clock.

\t A lu vagnévi sésúra quèla «schichta» … quèla dèv’ al tschagrún … gè , al tschagrún … cò diani al tschagrún a tudèstg ? …  f4  Ziger …  m3  Ziger … a lura cu quaj è … è … stèv’ ins pascá gjù quaj a métar ajn ajn quaj … quaj dèv’ usché ampau scù magnùc a quaj vagnéva lu schazagjau fétg .
\g and then come.IMPF.3SG.EXPL upon DEM.F.SG layer _ DEM.F.SG give.IMPF.3SG DEF.M.SG wey_cheese _ yes DEF.M.SG wey_cheese _ how say.PRS.3PL.3PL DEF.M.SG whey_cheese in German _ _ Ziger _ _ Ziger _ and then when DEM.UNM COP.PRS.3SG _ COP.PRS.3SG _ must.IMPF.3SG GNR fish.INF down DEM.UNM and put.INF in in DEM.UNM _ DEM.UNM give.IMPF.3SG so a_bit like cheese and DEM.UNM PASS.AUX.IMPF.3SG then appreciate.PTCP.UNM much
\l And then this layer would come up … this would yield the whey … yes, the whey … how do they call the Swiss German whey cheese? [f4] Ziger … [m3] Ziger … and then when this is … is … one had to skim this and put into into, this would produce something a bit like cheese and this was very appreciated.

\t A pér cu quaj èra fatg , scha èra la scòtga mèmi tgauda , api vèv’ al purtgè la quajda né né al plaṣchaj dad ira par au’ ad’ au’ ad aua … quèls zajvars da végn fùns , ṣchèvan nus … a purtá a métar ajn ála caldèra tòca tga èra tamprau , tg’ als pòrs savèvan magljè .
\g and only when DEM.UNM PASS.AUX.IMPF.3SG do.PTCP.UNM CORR COP.IMPF.3SG DEF.F.SG whey too hot and have.IMPF.3SG DEF.M.SG swineherd DEF.F.SG desire or or DEF.M.SG pleasure ATTR go.INF for water.F.SG and water and water _ DEM.M.PL washtub.PL of twenty pound.M.PL say.IMPF.1PL 1PL _ and bring.INF and put.INF in into.DEF.F.SG cauldron until SUBORD COP.IMPF.3SG lukewarm.PTCP.UNM SUBORD DEF.M.PL pig.PL can.IMPF.3PL eat.INF
\l And only when this was done was the whey too hot, and then the swineherd had the desire or or the pleasure to go and fetch water and water and water … these «washtubs of twenty pounds» as we used to say … and bring it and put it into the cheese cauldron until it was lukewarm so the pigs could eat it.

\t A lura quaj èran lèzs schòn lò a griavan a fagèvan al gjával … pi árvar sé in barcún api vagnévan quèls , quaj èra da quaj da trènta … trènta pòrs biabégn .
\g and then DEM.UNM COP.IMPF.3PL DEM.M.PL already there and shout.IMPF.3PL and do.IMPF.3PL DEF.M.PL devil _ and open.INF up INDEF.M.SG shutter and come.IMPF.3PL DEM.M.PL DEM.UNM COP.IMPF.3SG of DEM.UNM of thirty _ thirty pig.PL good.ADV
\l And then they were already there and shouted and behaved like the devil … and then open a shutter and then they would come, there were good thirty … thirty pigs.

\t A lur' vèv’ inṣ da dá … da magljè da lèzs … a quaj èra antir ritmus , antira stat … vagnéva lu plé pauc , ancúnt’ agl atún èri plé paucs tiarṣ a quaj ad è da quèlas , anstagl da mùngjar òtgònta vacas èri fòrsa mù tschuncònta , da quèlas tg’ èran schòn schétgas … a tutín’ al sjantarmjadṣdé èra … inṣ gudéva lu aun , in’ ura , duas … savèvas … schá dá l’ aura pals lárischs .
\g and then have.IMPF.3SG GNR to give.INF _ to eat.INF DAT DEM.M.PL _ and DEM.UNM COP.IMPF.3SG whole.M.SG rhythm whole.F.SG summer _ come.IMPF.3SG then more little towards DEF.M.SG autumn EXIST.IMPF.3SG.EXPL more little.M.PL animal.PL and DEM.UNM and also of DEM.F.PL instead SUBORD milk.INF eighty cow.F.PL EXIST.IMPF.3SG.EXPL maybe only fifty of DEM.F.PL REL COP.IMPF.3SG already dry.F.PL _ and after_all DEF.M.SG afternoon COP.IMPF.3SG _ GNR enjoy.IMPF.3SG then still one.F.SG hour two.F.PL _ can.IMPF.2SG.GNR _ let.INF give.INF DEF.F.SG weather through.DEF.M.PL larch.PL
\l And then one had to feed … feed them … and that was a constant movement, during the whole summer … fewer would come, towards autumn there were fewer animals and that and also of these, instead of milking eighty cows there were maybe only fifty, of those that already were without calves … and in the afternoon there was after all … one could then enjoy one hour, two, … one could … relax.

\t ˈmá ˈtôli
\g already bury-PST
\l S/he buried him/her.’§fn§In this particular example, the suffix vowel surfaces as [o] given an optional round harmony process, where non-round vowels of certain suffixes may become round when preceded by a stressed back stem vowel. This optional process is only attested in the speech of younger speakers. For more details about this process, see §subsubsec: round harmony.§/fn§

\l There’s no pleasing

\l Don’t be the dog in the manger

\l There’s no pleasing
